page.title: 04KENDALMANS ROAD GIGGLESWICK
page.content: This road is called{Kendalmans Road because it used to to be the way that people went to Kendal after crossing the old{ford}over the{River Ribble. Before my aunties house was built there in 1972 there used to be a field next to a barn. The flats across the road used to be a{barn,}and where my aunties bungalow is used to be a muck midden. Next to it used to be old slaughter houses and a 25 acre{meadow. There is now a footbridge across the river a bit further upstream that was built in 1980. Just next to the bridge is a large rock known as{Queens Rock. People who want to show how brave they are try to climb onto it. This is very {dangerous}because the river is very fast just here. If we have a lot of rain the rock is sometimes covered, but this does not happen too often.
